bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When running a virtual machine on current Fedora 24, KVM complains repeatedly about unhandled RDMSRs in the output of command 'dmesg':
"[ 1754.272193] kvm [5227]: vcpu1, guest rIP: 0xffffffffa5068de2 unhandled rdmsr: 0x60d ..."
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): kernel-4.6.4-301.fc24
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run a virtual machine in gnome-boxes. 2. Execute command 'dmesg'.
Actual results: Ouput of command 'dmesg' shows frequent entries of KVM complaining about unhandled RDMSRs.
Expected results: No complaints of KVM about unhandled RDMSRs.
Additional info: None

Why did you close this bug?
I run kernel-4.6.5-300.fc24.x86_64 and still have this messages in output of dmesg:
[17153.665846] kvm [12273]: vcpu3, guest rIP: 0xffffffff81065a52 unhandled rdmsr: 0x34 [17153.666337] kvm [12273]: vcpu3, guest rIP: 0xffffffff81065a52 unhandled rdmsr: 0x606 [17155.353301] kvm [12273]: vcpu0, guest rIP: 0xffffffff81065a52 unhandled rdmsr: 0x611 [17155.353676] kvm [12273]: vcpu0, guest rIP: 0xffffffff81065a52 unhandled rdmsr: 0x639 [17155.353921] kvm [12273]: vcpu0, guest rIP: 0xffffffff81065a52 unhandled rdmsr: 0x641 [17155.354127] kvm [12273]: vcpu0, guest rIP: 0xffffffff81065a52 unhandled rdmsr: 0x619

(In reply to Edgar Hoch from comment #1) I do not see KVM messages of this type any longer with kernel-4.6.5-300.fc24, and there have not been any comments contradicting this observation. Bug status CLOSED/ERRATA is irreversible; please open a new bug report and provide more details of your environment, thanks.
